subject: Mental Health
title: Cultural and Historical Trauma
description: A quick win: understand Cultural and Historical Trauma.

hook.text: Slavery, colonialism, and genocide leave wounds that last centuries.

buildup.text: Historical trauma refers to mass suffering imposed on a group across generations.

discovery.text: Affected communities show higher rates of addiction, depression, and chronic disease.

twist.text: The trauma is maintained through ongoing systemic inequality, not just memory.

climax.text: Healing requires both individual treatment and addressing structural injustice.

punchline.text: History isn't past when its wounds are still open.

quiz.question: What sustains historical trauma in communities?
